ground_truth: He indicates Ed with a nod of the head, clears his throat, and turns to the door. His tone is harder again as he snaps off the lights and disappears into the hall. Looking straight down at Hi, asleep in the trailer bedroom, we start to crane down over a beautiful dusk landscape. We are floating in over the field, abutting the prison, that Gale and Evelle popped out of. In the middle background of the extreme long shot, two men are walking across the field. Still floating forward but now much closer to the two walking men, we see that they are Gale and Evelle, both still dyed blue. They are approaching the hole in the ground, Evelle is starting to climb into the hole, and Evelle has disappeared and Gale starts climbing in. The front door has a holly wreath on it as five three-year-olds in their pajamas are opening presents around a tree as Nathan and Florence look on. We have been isolating in on one of the children peeling the wrappings off a package marked to Nathan Jr., inside of which is a shiny red plastic football. Pulled over on the state highway in the middle of the desert, a police motorcycle is parked behind it. Glen is leaning out the driver's window of the car talking to the state trooper who stands facing him. Glen is grinning and talking with his hands cupped in front of him, as when he told Hi about the Pollack who almost stepped in the pile of shit. The trooper, in crash helmet and dark sunglasses, is listening tight-lipped and stone-faced as Glen finishes his story and slaps his knee. The trooper is clicking open his ballpoint pen and reaching his citation book from his breast pocket. It sits on a tee in the middle of a football field, and a cleated foot boots the football out of frame. Looking up, arms out at his sides, waiting to receive the kicked ball, he catches the ball and starts running. He is skillfully eluding and stiff-arming tacklers, reaches the end zone, and triumphantly spikes the football. He whips off his helmet and we track in on the face of the rosy-cheeked high-school bruiser. Still craning down, now very close to the sleeping Hi, the man and woman are sitting on a sofa in the foreground with their backs to the camera. They are in the living room of Hi and Ed's trailer, which is suffused with a warm golden light. As they face the trailer's front door, all we see of the couple is the backs of their heads. They both have white hair, the woman's pulled into a bun, and the old man wears a cardigan, the woman a shawl.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: He signifies Ed with a gesture of the head, clears his throat, and pivots to the door. His manner is firmer again as he flicks off the lights and vanishes into the corridor. Staring directly down at Hi, asleep in the trailer bedroom, we commence to lean down over a stunning twilight scenery. We are gliding in over the field, adjacent to the penitentiary, that Gale and Evelle emerged from. In the central background of the extreme long shot, two men are strolling across the field. Still drifting forward but now much nearer to the two walking men, we discern that they are Gale and Evelle, both still tinted blue. They are nearing the cavity in the ground, Evelle is beginning to descend into the cavity, and Evelle has vanished and Gale starts descending in. The front door has a holly garland on it as five three-year-olds in their nightwear are unwrapping presents around a tree as Nathan and Florence observe. We have been zooming in on one of the children peeling the coverings off a parcel marked to Nathan Jr., inside of which is a glossy red plastic football. Pulled over on the state highway in the midst of the desert, a police motorcycle is parked behind it. Glen is leaning out the driver's window of the car conversing with the state trooper who stands facing him. Glen is grinning and speaking with his hands cupped in front of him, as when he told Hi about the Pollack who nearly stepped in the heap of excrement. The trooper, in crash helmet and dark sunglasses, is listening tight-lipped and expressionless as Glen concludes his tale and slaps his knee. The trooper is clicking open his ballpoint pen and extracting his citation book from his breast pocket. It sits on a tee in the center of a football field, and a cleated foot kicks the football out of frame. Looking up, arms out at his sides, waiting to receive the kicked ball, he catches the ball and starts sprinting. He is deftly evading and pushing away tacklers, reaches the end zone, and victoriously spikes the football. He removes his helmet and we track in on the visage of the rosy-cheeked high-school bruiser. Still leaning down, now very close to the sleeping Hi, the man and woman are seated on a sofa in the foreground with their backs to the camera. They are in the living room of Hi and Ed's trailer, which is suffused with a warm golden glow. As they face the trailer's front door, all we see of the couple is the backs of their heads. They both have white hair, the woman's pulled into a bun, and the old man sports a cardigan, the woman a shawl.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: Ed is indicated by him with a nod of the head, his throat is cleared, and the door is turned to by him. The lights are snapped off by him and the hall is disappeared into with a harder tone again. Hi is looked at by us, asleep in the trailer bedroom, and a beautiful dusk landscape is craned down over by us. Over the field abutting the prison, which was popped out of by Gale and Evelle, we are floating in. Across the field in the middle background of the extreme long shot, two men walk. Now much closer to the two walking men, they are seen by us as Gale and Evelle, both still dyed blue. The hole in the ground is approached by them, Evelle starts to climb into it, and Gale starts climbing in as Evelle disappears. A holly wreath is on the front door while presents are opened around a tree by five three-year-olds in their pajamas, observed by Nathan and Florence. We have isolated in on one of the children as the wrappings are peeled off by him from a package marked to Nathan Jr., inside of which a shiny red plastic football is found. Parked behind it, a police motorcycle is pulled over on the state highway in the middle of the desert. The driver's window of the car is leaned out of by Glen, who is talking to the state trooper facing him. Grinning and talking with his hands cupped in front of him, Glen is as when he told Hi about the Pollack who almost stepped in the pile of shit. Glen finishes his story and slaps his knee, listened to tight-lipped and stone-faced by the trooper in crash helmet and dark sunglasses. The trooper clicks open his ballpoint pen and reaches for his citation book in his breast pocket. The football field has a tee in the middle of it, and a cleated foot boots the football out of frame. Looking up, with arms out at his sides waiting to receive the kicked ball, the ball is caught by him, and running is begun. Tacklers are skillfully eluded and stiff-armed by him, the end zone is reached, and the football is triumphantly spiked. The helmet is whipped off by him, and the face of the rosy-cheeked high-school bruiser is tracked in on by us. Still craning down, now very close to the sleeping Hi, a sofa is sat on by the man and woman in the foreground with their backs to the camera. The living room of Hi and Ed's trailer is where they are, suffused with a warm golden light. Facing the trailer's front door, only the backs of the couple's heads are seen by us. Both have white hair: the woman's is pulled into a bun, and the old man wears a cardigan while the woman wears a shawl.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: With a nod toward Ed, he clears his throat, hardens his tone, turns off the lights, and exits into the hall. We gaze down at Hi, asleep in the trailer bedroom, then crane over a dusk landscape, floating above the field near the prison where Gale and Evelle emerged. Closer now, we see Gale and Evelle, still blue, approaching a hole; Evelle climbs in first, then Gale follows. The front door adorned with a holly wreath, five children in pajamas open presents around a tree as Nathan and Florence watch. One child unwraps a package for Nathan Jr., revealing a shiny red football. On a desert highway, a police motorcycle parks behind a car. Glen leans out the car window, talking animatedly to a stoic state trooper. As Glen finishes his story, the trooper prepares a citation. On a football field, a cleated foot kicks the ball. A player catches it, skillfully dodges tacklers, reaches the end zone, and spikes the ball before removing his helmet, revealing a rosy-cheeked high-school bruiser. Near Hi, now asleep, a man and woman sit with their backs to the camera in Hi and Ed's warm-lit trailer. They face the door, both with white hair—the woman's in a bun, the man in a cardigan, and the woman wears a shawl.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: He nods at Ed, clears his throat, and heads to the door. His tone hardens as he switches off the lights and exits. We look down at Hi, asleep in the trailer bedroom, and crane over a beautiful dusk landscape. Floating over the field by the prison, we see Gale and Evelle, still dyed blue, walking. Approaching a hole, Evelle climbs in, followed by Gale. Five three-year-olds in pajamas open presents around a tree with Nathan and Florence watching. One child unwraps a package labeled Nathan Jr., revealing a shiny red plastic football. On a desert highway, Glen leans out his car window, conversing with a stone-faced state trooper, who starts writing a citation. On a football field, a kicked ball flies. A player catches, eludes tacklers, reaches the end zone, spikes the ball, removes his helmet, revealing a rosy-cheeked high-schooler. Near the sleeping Hi, a couple sits on a sofa in the warm-lit trailer. The camera shows only their backs; the woman has a bun, and the man wears a cardigan.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: He subtly gestures towards Ed with a deliberate nod of his head, clears his throat in preparation, and decisively turns towards the door. His demeanor shifts, becoming more stern and resolved, as he briskly snaps off the lights, casting the room into darkness, and quickly disappears into the hallway. Our perspective shifts to a view straight down at Hi, who is peacefully asleep in the trailer's bedroom, and as we begin to crane downwards, we glide over a stunning dusk landscape that unfolds before us. We find ourselves gently floating in over a vast field that is adjacent to the prison where Gale and Evelle made their escape. In the wide expanse of the extreme long shot, we can barely make out two figures walking across the distant field. As we continue gliding forward, gradually drawing closer to the figures, it becomes clear that these men are indeed Gale and Evelle, both of whom are still conspicuously dyed blue. They approach a hole in the ground; Evelle begins to climb down into it and soon disappears, followed by Gale who starts climbing in as well. At the front door of a cozy home, adorned with a festive holly wreath, five small children, all around three years old and clad in their cozy pajamas, are joyfully opening presents surrounding a brightly decorated tree. Nearby, Nathan and Florence watch them with loving eyes. Our focus narrows in on one of the children who is eagerly peeling the wrappings off a present labeled for Nathan Jr., revealing a shiny, vibrant red plastic football. Meanwhile, on the deserted state highway, a police motorcycle is strategically parked behind a car. Glen, with a wide grin, is leaning out of the driver’s window of the car, animatedly conversing with a state trooper who stands there, facing him. Glen is gesticulating with his hands, much like he did when recounting to Hi the amusing tale of the Pollack who nearly stepped into a pile of shit. The state trooper, wearing a crash helmet and dark sunglasses, listens with a stoic, tight-lipped expression as Glen wraps up his story, punctuating it with a knee slap. The trooper methodically clicks open his ballpoint pen and retrieves his citation book from his breast pocket, ready for the next step. On a football field, a ball rests atop a tee, and with a swift motion, a cleated foot kicks the ball out of frame. We shift our view upward to see a player, arms outstretched to the sides, eagerly awaiting the incoming kicked ball. With precision, he catches the ball and takes off running. His agility is apparent as he skillfully dodges and stiff-arms would-be tacklers, ultimately reaching the end zone where he triumphantly spikes the football into the ground. In a moment of celebration, he removes his helmet, allowing us to focus in on the face of the exuberant, rosy-cheeked high-school player. Our crane shot continues to descend, bringing us very close to the sleeping Hi, while a man and a woman sit together on a sofa in the foreground, their backs turned towards our view. They are situated in the living room of Hi and Ed's trailer, which is enveloped in a warm and inviting golden light. As they gaze towards the trailer's front door, the only detail we can discern is the backs of their heads. The couple both have white hair, with the woman's hair elegantly pulled into a bun, while the old man dons a cozy cardigan and the woman wraps herself in a comfortable shawl.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
With a subtle gesture that barely catches the eye, he directs attention towards Ed through a deliberate and intentional nod of his head. He then pauses for a moment, clearing his throat as if to prepare himself for what comes next, and turns decisively towards the door. His entire demeanor changes, becoming markedly more stern and resolute, as he briskly switches off the lights with a quick snap, plunging the room into sudden darkness, and then swiftly disappears down the hallway. Our perspective shifts dramatically to an aerial view directly over Hi, who lies peacefully and deeply asleep in the bedroom of the trailer. As the camera begins to crane downwards, we glide gracefully over a breathtaking landscape illuminated by the soft glow of dusk. This stunning view unfolds before us as we find ourselves gently floating above a vast expanse of field located adjacent to the prison where Gale and Evelle staged their daring escape. In the expansive wide shot that captures the sweeping field, we can just barely discern two figures making their way across the distant terrain. As we continue to glide ever so smoothly forward, gradually drawing nearer to the distant figures, it becomes unmistakably clear that these two men are indeed Gale and Evelle. Both of them remain conspicuously dyed blue, a vivid reminder of their recent escapade. They soon approach a hole in the ground, and Evelle takes the lead by beginning to climb down into it, vanishing from sight, quickly followed by Gale, who starts to climb in after him. 

At the front door of a cozy home that is charmingly adorned with a festive holly wreath, we see five small children, all around the tender age of three, dressed snugly in their cozy pajamas. They are joyfully and excitedly opening presents, gathered around a brightly decorated tree that shines with festive lights. Nearby, Nathan and Florence stand watching the scene with eyes filled with love and warmth. Our focus narrows in on one particular child who is eagerly peeling the wrappings off a present labeled for Nathan Jr. The child reveals inside a shiny and vibrant red plastic football. Meanwhile, on a deserted state highway, a police motorcycle is strategically parked behind a car. Glen, sporting a wide and infectious grin, leans out of the driver’s window of the car, animatedly engaging in conversation with a state trooper who stands there, directly facing him. Glen, as enthusiastic as ever, gestures animatedly with his hands, much in the same manner as he did when sharing with Hi the amusing anecdote of the Pollack who almost found himself stepping into a pile of shit. The state trooper, wearing a crash helmet and dark sunglasses, listens with a stoic, tight-lipped expression as Glen brings his story to a close, punctuating it with a hearty knee slap. The trooper then methodically clicks open his ballpoint pen and retrieves his citation book from his breast pocket, clearly ready to proceed with the next step.

On a football field, we observe a ball resting carefully atop a tee. With a swift, dynamic motion, a cleated foot makes contact, sending the ball flying out of frame. Our view shifts upward to reveal a player standing with arms outstretched to the sides, eagerly awaiting the incoming ball. With precision and focus, he catches the ball and takes off running with impressive speed and agility. He skillfully dodges and stiff-arms would-be tacklers, darting past them with ease, and ultimately reaches the end zone where he triumphantly spikes the football into the ground. In a moment of celebratory exuberance, he removes his helmet, allowing us to focus in on the face of the jubilant, rosy-cheeked high school player. As our crane shot continues its descent, it brings us very close once again to the sleeping Hi, while in the foreground, a man and woman sit together on a sofa, their backs turned towards us. They are situated in the inviting living room of Hi and Ed's trailer, which is warmly aglow with a comforting golden light. As they gaze towards the trailer's front door, the only detail visible to us is the backs of their heads. The couple both share white hair, with the woman's styled into an elegantly neat bun, while the older man wears a cozy cardigan, and the woman wraps herself in a shawl that speaks of warmth and comfort.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: He indicates Ed with a subtle nod of the head, clearing his throat with a quick cough, and then pivots smoothly to face the door. His demeanor shifts to become more authoritative as he sharply turns off the lights and swiftly exits into the hallway. We are then presented with a downward view of Hi, who lies asleep in the trailer bedroom. Our perspective begins to gradually move downward across a striking dusk landscape. We glide over a field adjacent to the prison, the very field from which Gale and Evelle had previously emerged. In the middle distance of an extensive long shot, two figures can be seen making their way across the field. As we continue to glide forward and draw nearer to the two figures, it becomes clear that they are indeed Gale and Evelle, still sporting their blue-dyed appearance. Their destination is a hole in the ground, and we observe Evelle beginning to descend into this hole, consequently disappearing from view, followed by Gale who also starts his descent. Meanwhile, at a different location, the front door of a house is adorned with a festive holly wreath. Inside, a group of five three-year-olds, dressed in their pajamas, are joyfully unwrapping presents around a Christmas tree as Nathan and Florence watch them fondly. Our focus narrows in on one specific child who is slowly peeling back the wrapping paper from a package addressed to Nathan Jr. Within this package lies a shiny red plastic football. Elsewhere, on a desolate state highway cutting through the desert, a police motorcycle is stationed behind a car. Leaning out of the driver's window of this car is Glen, who engages in conversation with a state trooper standing opposite him. Glen is smiling broadly, using expressive hand gestures reminiscent of when he previously recounted to Hi about the Pollack nearly stepping into a pile of shit. The trooper, wearing a crash helmet and dark sunglasses, listens with a tight-lipped and expressionless demeanor. As Glen concludes his story with a jovial knee slap, the trooper methodically clicks open his ballpoint pen and retrieves his citation book from the breast pocket of his uniform. Transitioning to another scene, a football sits perched on a tee at the center of a football field. The scene captures a cleated foot making contact with the football, sending it soaring out of the frame. We then see a player looking up with arms extended, ready to catch the incoming ball. After successfully catching the ball, he begins to run, deftly evading and pushing away would-be tacklers. Upon reaching the end zone, he exuberantly spikes the football into the ground. In a moment of victory, he removes his helmet, revealing the face of a rosy-cheeked high school athlete. Returning to the earlier setting, we are now craning down much closer to Hi, who is still asleep. In the foreground, a man and woman sit on a sofa with their backs to the camera in the warmly lit living room of Hi and Ed's trailer. Facing the trailer's front door, only the backs of their heads are visible to us. Both possess white hair, with the woman's hair arranged in a bun and the old man clad in a cardigan while the woman wraps a shawl around her shoulders.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: He indicates Ed with a nod, clears his throat, and turns to the door, adopting a harder tone as he snaps off the lights and disappears into the hall. We crane down from Hi, asleep in the trailer bedroom, over a beautiful dusk landscape, floating above the field next to the prison where Gale and Evelle emerged. In the distance, we see Gale and Evelle, both dyed blue, walking across the field toward a hole. Evelle climbs into the hole, followed by Gale. Inside a house decorated with a holly wreath, five three-year-olds in pajamas open presents around a tree, while Nathan and Florence look on. One child unwraps a package labeled for Nathan Jr., revealing a shiny red plastic football. On a desert highway, a police motorcycle is parked behind a car as Glen, leaning out the driver’s window, talks animatedly to a stone-faced state trooper. As Glen finishes his story with a knee slap, the trooper, wearing a crash helmet and sunglasses, retrieves his citation book. In a football field, a cleated foot kicks the ball out of the frame. A player catches it, eludes tacklers, and reaches the end zone, triumphantly spiking the ball before removing his helmet, revealing a rosy-cheeked high-school bruiser. Back in Hi and Ed's warmly lit trailer, we see an elderly couple with white hair, the woman’s in a bun and the man in a cardigan, sitting with their backs to the camera, facing the front door.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: He indicates Ed, who has been his trusted colleague for years, with a nod of the head, clears his throat, and turns to the door. His tone is harder again as he snaps off the lights and disappears into the hall, which echoes with the creaking of old wood. Looking straight down at Hi, asleep in the trailer bedroom, we start to crane down over a beautiful dusk landscape painted in hues of orange and purple. We are floating in over the field, abutting the prison known for its high-security measures, that Gale and Evelle popped out of in their daring escape. In the middle background of the extreme long shot, two men are walking across the field. Still floating forward but now much closer to the two walking men, we see that they are Gale and Evelle, both still dyed blue from their mishap with the dye pack during the robbery. They are approaching the hole in the ground infamous for its use in the Shawshank escape, Evelle is starting to climb into the hole, and Evelle has disappeared and Gale starts climbing in. The front door has a holly wreath on it, a symbol of holiday cheer, as five three-year-olds in their pajamas are opening presents around a tree as Nathan and Florence look on with warm smiles. We have been isolating in on one of the children peeling the wrappings off a package marked to Nathan Jr., inside of which is a shiny red plastic football, reminiscent of the classic toys popular in the 1980s. Pulled over on the state highway in the middle of the desert, a police motorcycle is parked behind it. Glen is leaning out the driver's window of the car talking animatedly to the state trooper, who stands facing him with the stoicism of a seasoned officer. Glen is grinning and talking with his hands cupped in front of him, as when he told Hi about the Pollack, a joke he often recycled for laughs, who almost stepped in the pile of shit. The trooper, in crash helmet and dark sunglasses reflecting the scorching sun, is listening tight-lipped and stone-faced as Glen finishes his story and slaps his knee. The trooper is clicking open his ballpoint pen, known for its reliability, and reaching his citation book from his breast pocket. It sits on a tee in the middle of a football field, marked with the colors of the local high school, and a cleated foot boots the football out of frame with practiced precision. Looking up, arms out at his sides, waiting to receive the kicked ball, he catches the ball and starts running with the agility of a seasoned athlete. He is skillfully eluding and stiff-arming tacklers, reaches the end zone, and triumphantly spikes the football in a celebratory move familiar to fans of the game. He whips off his helmet and we track in on the face of the rosy-cheeked high-school bruiser, who is known for leading his team to victory. Still craning down, now very close to the sleeping Hi, the man and woman are sitting on a sofa in the foreground with their backs to the camera. They are in the living room of Hi and Ed's trailer, which is suffused with a warm golden light from the setting sun. As they face the trailer's front door, all we see of the couple is the backs of their heads. They both have white hair, the woman's pulled into a bun, and the old man wears a cardigan, the woman a shawl, both attire choices that speak to a simpler era.

In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: She gestures toward Linda with a tilt of the hat, hums a tune, and strolls to the window. Her expression is softer again as she flicks on the fan and reappears in the garden. Gazing upward at Lo, snoring in the attic loft, we begin to zoom up over a stunning dawn skyline. We are drifting over the pond, bordering the library, that Stu and Vinnie leapt out of. In the near foreground of the broad wide angle, two women are jogging across the meadow. Still drifting backward but now much farther from the two jogging women, we see that they are Stu and Vinnie, both still painted green. They are departing from the mound in the meadow, Vinnie is beginning to hop away from the mound, and Vinnie has vanished and Stu starts hopping away. The back gate has a daisy garland on it as five five-year-olds in their robes are decorating baubles around a fountain as Martha and Henry observe. We have been focusing in on one of the kids tearing the packaging off a box labeled to Martha Jr., inside of which is a shiny blue plastic frisbee. Parked on the country road in the heart of the forest, a state tractor is positioned beside it. Clay is standing outside the passenger door of the truck chatting to the forest ranger who sits facing him. Clay is frowning and gesturing with his elbows tucked behind him, as when he told Lo about the Swedish chef who almost stepped in the puddle of goo. The ranger, in straw hat and mirrored goggles, is observing wide-eyed and open-mouthed as Clay concludes his tale and taps his shoe. The ranger is snapping shut his pocket knife and drawing a notebook from his hip pocket. It rests on a shelf in the corner of a basketball court, and a bare foot taps the frisbee out of sight. Glancing down, hands raised at his hips, ready to intercept the tossed frisbee, she snags the frisbee and starts leaping. She is gracefully dodging and sidestepping defenders, reaches the hoop, and exuberantly slams the frisbee. She pulls off her cap and we track in on the face of the sunburnt college athlete. Still zooming up, now extremely far from the snoring Lo, the boy and girl are lounging in a hammock in the distance with their faces to the sea. They are on the veranda of Lo and Linda’s cabin, which is bathed in a cool silver glow. As they face the cabin's back window, all we see of the duo is the tops of their heads. They both have red hair, the girl's loose and flowing, and the young boy wears a hoodie, the girl a cape.

test_cases.name: Object-Action Corruption

Still gliding sideways, now extremely near to the slumbering Hi, the child and dog are lounging on a bench in the foreground with their profiles to the viewer. They are in the den of Hi and Ed's trailer, which is bathed with a soft silver glow. As they gaze at the trailer's side window, all we perceive of the pair is their profiles. They both have brown hair, the dog's tied with a ribbon, and the young boy wears a hoodie, the dog a bandana.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption

Gazing directly down at Jo, napping in the boat cabin, we begin to drift upwards over a vibrant dawn seascape. We are gliding above the garden, adjoining the factory, that Sam and Alex jumped out of. Max is smirking and gesturing with his hands wiggling in front of him, as when he told Jo about the Swede who nearly slipped in the puddle of mud. The firefighter, in rain hat and yellow goggles, is observing tight-lipped and stone-faced as Max concludes his tale and claps his elbow. The firefighter is clicking open his felt-tip marker and pulling his notepad from his coat pocket. It lies on a blanket in the middle of a baseball diamond, and a sneakered foot nudges the chicken out of view. Gazing down, hands on his hips, prepared to grasp the launched toy, he snags the toy and starts leaping. He is expertly dodging and shoulder-checking pursuers, arrives at home base, and jubilantly slams the chicken. He tears off his cap and we pan in on the grinning face of the sunburnt college sprinter. Still drifting upwards, now very close to the dozing Jo, the teenager and child are lounging on a recliner in the background with their faces to the camera. They are in the study of Jo and Tom's boat, which is illuminated with a cool silver sheen. As they gaze at the boat's rear window, all we observe of the duo is the fronts of their shirts. They both have brown hair, the child's styled into a ponytail, and the old teenager wears a hoodie, the child a scarf.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: The scene opens with Ed nodding towards someone before leaving and turning off the lights. The view shifts to Hi, asleep in the trailer bedroom, as the scene transitions over a dusk landscape near the prison where Gale and Evelle escape. Approaching a hole, both men, still dyed blue, disappear into it. Meanwhile, at a home decorated with a holly wreath, five toddlers in pajamas unwrap gifts while Nathan and Florence watch. One child opens a package labeled for Nathan Jr., revealing a red plastic football. On a desert highway, Glen talks animatedly to a state trooper, whose expression remains stern and who prepares to issue a citation. On a football field, a player receives a kick, dodges tacklers, and triumphantly scores. Back in Hi and Ed's warmly lit trailer, an elderly couple sits with their backs to the camera, showcasing white hair; hers in a bun, his with a cardigan.

and woman are sitting on a sofa in the foreground with their backs to the camera Evelle is starting to climb into the hole and Evelle has disappeared and Gale starts climbing in The front door has a holly wreath on it as five threeyearolds in their pajamas are opening presents around a tree as Nathan and Florence look on They are in the living room of Hi and Ed's trailer which is suffused with a warm golden light He indicates Ed with a nod of the head clears his throat and turns to the door We are floating in over the field abutting the prison that Gale and Evelle popped out of He whips off his helmet and we track in on the face of the rosycheeked highschool bruiser

test_cases.name: Rotate Half Paragraph
test_cases.description: The trooper in crash helmet and dark sunglasses is listening tightlipped and stonefaced as Glen finishes his story and slaps his knee The trooper is clicking open his ballpoint pen and reaching his citation book from his breast pocket It sits on a tee in the middle of a football field and a cleated foot boots the football out of frame Looking up arms out at his sides waiting to receive the kicked ball he catches the ball and starts running He is skillfully eluding and stiffarming tacklers reaches the end zone and triumphantly spikes the football He whips off his helmet and we track in on the face of the rosycheeked highschool bruiser Still craning down now very close to the sleeping Hi the man and woman are sitting on a sofa in the foreground with their backs to the camera They are in the living room of Hi and Ed's trailer which is suffused with a warm golden light As they face the trailer's front door all we see of the couple is the backs of their heads They both have white hair the woman's pulled into a bun and the old man wears a cardigan the woman a shawl He indicates Ed with a nod of the head clears his throat and turns to the door His tone is harder again as he snaps off the lights and disappears into the hall Looking straight down at Hi asleep in the trailer bedroom we start to crane down over a beautiful dusk landscape We are floating in over the field abutting the prison that Gale and Evelle popped out of In the middle background of the extreme long shot two men are walking across the field Still floating forward but now much closer to the two walking men we see that they are Gale and Evelle both still dyed blue They are approaching the hole in the ground Evelle is starting to climb into the hole and Evelle has disappeared and Gale starts climbing in The front door has a holly wreath on it as five threeyearolds in their pajamas are opening presents around a tree as Nathan and Florence look on We have been isolating in on one of the children peeling the wrappings off a package marked to Nathan Jr inside of which is a shiny red plastic football Pulled over on the state highway in the middle of the desert a police motorcycle is parked behind it Glen is leaning out the driver's window of the car talking to the state trooper who stands facing him Glen is grinning and talking with his hands cupped in front of him as when he told Hi about the Pollack who almost stepped in the pile of shit
